id0: How about subscribing to me at codepen? I promise to post something interesting and different.
id1: Here you can see 3D plywood paintings crafted through the process of laser cutting, following my initial blueprints created with CorelDRAW, Photoshop, and AutoCAD. These works showcase my proficiency in these software tools.
id2: I used to have a workshop where I designed a variety of custom projects, and you can take a look at some of them here.
id3: I designed some creative posters and banners some of which can be seen here.
id4: I designed some creative posters and banners some of which can be seen here.
id5: I've changed my website design three times, but the last design was pretty cool too. You can explore the archived version.
id6:
A little bit about this website.

My site uses modern HTML 5 and CSS3 features, the JavaScript code is written using the closures technique and the "module" pattern. When I thought about the architecture, I was guided by Kyle Simpson's "You Don't Know JavaScript Yet" series of books and SOLID principles.

I intended this site as my business card, even if it doesn't look like a standard resume. I believe that the most important thing in work is to stay yourself, to stay real and not to live behind a mask, to put your whole soul into your work, making the world a little better.
id7:
Can't find meaning in your worthless life?

Don't know where to find solutions to life's most important questions?

Or maybe you just can't find your car keys?

Like Prometheus giving fire, I bring you a new idol. Jake the fortune-dog guarantees you frustration and quick fixes to any vital and unimportant issues, leading to unpredictable and dire consequences. Ask now!
